post.body: Simple, Llamas are a brand of gun. http://tinyurl.com/479jyn
Key concept is that it is "selective" hyperfocus. As in people who choose to deeply deeply geek out on a specific type of tech.
Boring is the last word I would use to describe you. You might have selective hyperfocus and that makes conversations interesting.
Cayanne, paprika and cinnamon all work and have the lovely benefit of being non-toxic.
Oh there is no way in intarnation that I can keep my plate clear. I can easily choose to take less on though. Totally doable too!
I'm working an underage NYE rave at CELL Space. Which means that there is alot of inexperienced drunkeness. Fun fun fun! :)
I agree with that ruling!
We are the all singing, all dancing Bacon of the world?!? http://tinyurl.com/3o4vrg (real ad spoofing Citroen dancing car ad)
I have a daily average of 3.92, @spin has an ave. of 24.14, @scobleizer has an ave. of 21.32, @guykawasaki has an ave. of 32.0.
You think I tweet a lot? For a perspective shift: @spin (18165 tweets), @scobleizer (16435 tweets), @guykawasaki (15744 tweets)
By starting I mean I am finishing up for the night but I still have 400 photos to go. G'night Tweeps!
Starting the process of sorting through almost 600 underwater shots.
Having a rough day? Need a distraction or just want to watch some cuteness? Need a Cute Overload alt? http://www.cutethingsfallingasleep.org
Organizational/Interpersonal cleanup conversations can be *so* satisfying & really improves working relationships. NTS: do whenever possible
Organizational rejiggering commencing! Stand behind the safety glass ladies and gentlemen, I'm going to use live high-test politics.
The term "selective hyperfocus" isn't defined anywhere but it should be. "A highly functional idiot savant by choice, often tech focused."
Apparently while on vacation ants decided to move in to my house... Now where did I put the cayenne pepper?
I'm back home. Tearing through the pile of incoming like it is going out of style. The usual and deep post-vacation work hole needs filling.
Is full of the aloha spirit.
Now at airport. Real world slowly starting to sink in. Voice mails, emails, meetings, priorities and deadlines, oh my!
Can't help the Palin joke but I saw the UK from Hawaii today. The Cook memorial is soverign British soil. All 25 Sq Ft of it.
http://twitpic.com/tpyh - Just for Boris Popkoff: A picture of Donkey Balls & Donkey Nuts
Last day of vacation!
For you dive geeks following me... Bad news: No more diving for me this trip. Am happy bottom time was pretty decent. Ave. 45-50 min/dive.
And for those keeping score: With a 630am wake up to make our dive boat that makes this a 18 hour day. I'm on vacation, right? Time for Zzzz
Turns out that with driving and stopping for a meal the total time spent getting to/from Kilauea was 9 hours (speed limits here are *low*).
At Sea of Dreams checking out the scene.
Anyone going to/fro a party or event in SF able to bring me something warm to drink at Cell Space? Nothing near is open and I'm stuck here.
Happy New Year! My resolution, which I tweeted some weeks ago, is to take less on. Also doing an alcohol free January with @steve23 & co.
Resting at home, getting ready for the NYE events happening tonight. Working until 5am means low chance of Breakfast of Champions for me.
New version of Twitterfon rocks! Auto: loading all tabs, refresh and scroll to 1st tweet. RT button, list view friends/followers and # tags.
http://twitpic.com/y6bm - Damon, broken and double fisting, on his birthday.
In Campbell with the usual geek suspects getting Damon L. good and broken, code ETOH, for his birthday. Softened him up with sushi first.
Satisfying: having a clean house. Even more satisfying: not having to do it yourself! Many thanks to @missmeliss, who rocked it hard.
Twitter user @2drinksbehind Tweeted real time about surviving 737 airplane crash. Related blog coverage: http://tinyurl.com/8oq4bn
Awesome Canadian "Firefly" parody titled "Mosquito." Preview Video: http://tinyurl.com/9glwnr Home Page: http://www.mosquitoverse.com/
Muppet? Check. Sinister? Yup. Minister? Yes. Rapping? Uh huh. Evil League of Evil? Accepted. ---> Result? Awesome! http://tinyurl.com/63d9kq
Just spent another couple of hours cleaning/organizing/sorting in the attic at mom's. Found my childhood embroidered train shirt & quilt. :)
RT @laughingsquid "The Times of Harvey Milk", the amazing 1984 documentary about Harvey Milk, is now available on Hulu http://bit.ly/1kEQSa
One of three people at the office today. Amazing how much better the internet connection is w/o people streaming music or sucking bandwidth.
